justification: The article states that "Experimental research on decisions from experience has typically involved a simple experimental tool: a ‘computerized money machine’ … Each click of a button implements a random draw … Choices that people make in these experimental paradigms are then compared…" indicating this device is the standard measure for the construct.

measured_by: monetary gambles with explicitly stated outcomes and probabilities
justification: It explains that "most scholars have relied on gambles in which all information about the options’ outcomes and their probabilities are explicitly stated… leaving people to make a decision from description," showing the described-gamble task operationalizes decision making from description.

measured_by: choice task involving one risky and one safe option
justification: The paper notes that "when a choice involves a risky and a safe option—the choice task often used to measure risk preference behaviorally (see Hertwig & Wulff, Mata, 2019)," explicitly linking this specific choice task to measurement of risk preference.
